content.raw:
I'm a little worried about the naming of the `[Set|Get][Force|Torque]()` functions. There are many different categories of force that act on a body:

1. External forces applied by:

    1. Collision
    2. Friction
    3. Other physical systems \(e.g. magnetic\)
    4. The “Hand of God” \(i.e. the user applying a force for experimental purposes\)
    
2. Internal forces applied by:

    1. Joint constraints
    2. Actuator force
    

Having a function that's just called `SetForce(~)` leaves it ambiguous which of the above categories of force are being set. I would assume it means 1\(d\), but I can't rule out the possibility that it might also overwrite the values of 1\(a-c\). Having a function called `GetForce(~)` might imply that it's the sum of all the forces 1\(a-d\) \+ 2\(a-b\), but then it wouldn’t be symmetrical with the `SetForce(~)` function.

I would recommend that we make these function names more specific. Some possible names to consider:

    [Set|Get]AppliedForce() // refers to 1(d)
    GetExternalForce() // refers to the sum of 1(a-d)
    GetInternalForce() // refers to the sum of 2(a-b)
    GetNetForce() // refers to the sum of all forces
